snippet: In the Gideon v. Wainwright decision, which held that states must provide legal representation for the poor in serious criminal cases, the Supreme Court unanimously overturned its own 1942 decision in the landmark case of Betts v. Brady.
lead_paragraph: In the Gideon v. Wainwright decision, which held that states must provide legal representation for the poor in serious criminal cases, the Supreme Court unanimously overturned its own 1942 decision in the landmark case of Betts v. Brady.

headline.main: The Times’s 1963 Article on the Gideon v. Wainwright Decision
